data.title: amscripten chromium doesn’t  start
data.body:
I did a quick test with the new html5 export improvements.

The exported game in firefox works apparently fine, but in crhomium it doesn’t load.
the console shows this output:

```
let it go!
[1;31;40mERROR: get_executable_path: [1;37;40mWarning, don't know how to obtain executable path on this OS! Please override this function properly.
[0;31;40m   At: drivers/unix/os_unix.cpp:492.[0;0;37m
has res dir: 
exists engine cfg? 0
loaded engine.cfg
Init OS
Could not create canvas: Web page was not allowed to create a WebGL context.,:(,{"antialias":false,"alpha":false,"depth":true,"stencil":false,"majorVersion":1,"minorVersion":0}
Init Audio
Init VS
```

os: ubuntu 15.04
Firefox 40.0.3
Chromium 44.0.2403.89
nvidia GTS 450 with nv proprietary driver version 346.59
cpu: i5-2500 CPU @ 3.30GHz × 4 
16 GB ram

data.title: Unable to declare custom signal
data.body:
If I read the wiki https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/wiki/gdscript correctly, custom signals are just declared like this:

```
extends Node

signal my_signal

func _ready():
    pass
```

This does not work however. I get an error "Unexpected token: Identifier: signal" no matter what I try (with or without signal args, for instance).

This is with Godot 1.1 on OSX Yosemite.

data.title: Stuck at the opening of the project for editing.
data.body:
It is not clear for what reason, and after some action, but sometimes the following occurs:
Start the editor. Try to open the project and application. A window opens and immediately hangs up.
If you open and close the editor again, it will be the same.
Only helps to restart your computer.

![gd_err_2015_09_12](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/233268/9830285/4ba384c0-5931-11e5-9e72-fcac078c19e3.jpg)

data.title: many nodes in the same position do queue_free(),cause lag.
data.body: In platform2d demo,if there are many coins(for me,if number>=5 on my compute) in the same position. When the player eat them at the same time,there will appear a pause.

data.title: set_visible_characters for RichTextLabel
data.body:
I'm essentially paraphrasing #1329 here, but with a clear feature request.

After all the styling is applied, the number of characters on each is determined already in rich_text_label.cpp (as far as I understand). Setting the number of visible characters (as in TextLabel) should be possible from there.

data.title: fixed iOS splash screen
data.body: ios now displays splash screen between launch image and main scene, instead of a black screen.  Note that the duplicated "[self drawView];" line in gl_view.mm is deliberate.  This prevents first frame from being drawn black, and causing a brief black screen between launch image and splash screen.

data.title: fix save resources/scenes, fixes #2415
data.body: I would double-check this one, I'm not sure if this is the appropriate way to check for type.  But, I think this at least fixes the problem.  See issue #2415.

data.title: Fix HScrollBar of TextEdit
data.body: Fix TextEdit to show all text, when moving horizontal scroll bar to max value.

data.title: Fix absolute paths used in doxygen, ignore generated documentation in Git
data.body: Relative paths are better for cross-platform usage.  Puts the documentation in the appropriate `doc` folder.

data.title: [Feature Required] virtual keyboard on mobile
data.body: It is possible to have a virtual keyboard for mobile input textbox?

data.title: [UI fix] Hide opened menu when click on menu button
data.body:
When you click a MenuButton, it opens a PopupMenu underneath it.  However, the only way to close the PopupMenu without selecting an item is to click outside the MenuButton and the PopupMenu.  Depending on the layout, this may be difficult.  In order to conform with other GUI systems, the PopupMenu will now close when the MenuButton is pressed.

Simple, but I think it's important. :)

data.title: Missing "test_data" folder in unit tests
Distance field for all controls.
data.body: For now, only label work well with distance field, if it's possible, would be nice to have this for the rest of controls like buttons, checkboxs, etc.

data.title: Thin lines around tiles in Platformer 2D Demo
data.body:
I can see thin lines around tiles in Platformer 2D Demo.

Using just compiled latest git HEAD on Ubuntu and an Intel graphics controller.

![2015-09-08-164959_1280x1024_scrot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/616169/9738113/4b6b8230-564a-11e5-9512-cfae5d4cc4a1.png)

data.title: Fixed bug with adding an instance from the FIleSystem dialog.
data.body: This is a fix for a bug preventing the add instance button from working in the FileSystem dialog.

data.title: Quick projects setup for prototyping
data.body: Godot is great for prototyping an idea and see how it works. I was thinking that for speeding up a little the setup of creating a new project in Godot a button should be added, and when pressed, will fill the _project path_ (my guess is to let the user configure Godot to use a predefine root path for this kind of projects) and _project name_ automatically and leave the user ready with a new project for prototyping.

data.title: reworked Label class
data.body:
- no longer inherits Range - instead, more sensible
  function names controlling lines visible
- more accurate vertical alignment
- percent_visible preserved even after setting new text

Largely motivated by the frustratingly inaccurate vertical alignment, particularly with large fonts.
Before: https://gfycat.com/WaterySimpleHornedtoad
After: https://gfycat.com/NeighboringMetallicKilldeer

The code for controlling the lines visible was already there, but I changed it so that instead of using `set_val()` and `set_max()` you now use `set_lines_skipped()` and `set_max_lines_visible()`.

Also, `percent_visible` and `visible_chars` are now recalculated properly each time you use `set_text()` because that could change the total length, and when you use `set_visible_characters()`.

data.title: Automatically create instances of an object while importing 3d Scene
data.body: When you import a full 3D scene with objects (meshes) with the same name, like "object", "object.001", "object.002", and so on, give the option to import the base object, and then instance the copies preserving position, scale and rotation of the individual instances, and not importing them as unique objects, regarding optimization.

data.title: Possibility to deactivate a node
data.body:
Is it possible to have option to deactivate a node?
With deactivating I mean completely invisible, no collision, no running script.

I think in special about this nodes:
- CanvasModulate
- CollisionObject
